title: Online Learning: Studio Lighting
description: In this course, you will learn how to set up lighting and reflections similar to a real world studio.
longDescription:
For those interested in lighting objects using studio lighting techniques, learn with Unreal Engine expert Paul Kind as he deconstructs the process of making studio lighting work for you in-engine. Begin by exploring some of the lighting setups that can transform the look of a scene. Learn about the importance of reflections, IES lights, and blueprints, and then walk through each step in creating your own studio lighting scene. By building your own custom set, you will gain the ability to create virtually any lighting setup. Additionally, you will learn how to make a 360-degree camera rig using the supplied turn table blueprint and generate rendered sequences. By the course’s conclusion, you will have all the tools and skills needed to create, light, and render your own 3D objects using studio techniques.


Expect To Learn:

- create a studio template and scene

- set up IES lights

- set up and tweak reflection probes

- build a center-looking rotating camera rig

- render your scene
technicalDetails: Created in Unreal Engine version 4.21, use these files to follow along with Paul Kind as he walks you through the practice of setting up a Studio Lighting environment.
